result.execSummary:
The defendant Randal G. Fitzsimmons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Randal G. Fitzsimmons is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Randal G. Fitzsimmons was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.

Consecutive to: Sentence shall commence on or before Court ordered start date;  with work release and transfer privileges

Defendant Randal G. Fitzsimmons in court with attorney Steven John Luchsinger.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion held; victim makes statement; parties make sentencing arguments; defendant makes statement; Court heard and sentence is imposed:

Defendant Randal G. Fitzsimmons in court with attorney Steven John Luchsinger.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews rights, charges and penalties. Court denies request to modify bond. Court sets sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2016 at 12:30 pm.

for Continuance - DENIED

ADA Sempf appears for State. Def FTA. Atty Luchsinger does not appear. ADA Sempf heard; Atty Luchsinger faxed continuance at lunch; victim did appear today - objects to continuance; State agrees with victim, requests WA. Court denies continuance; issues warrant and forfeits bond.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with CMW or her residence.   Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.

9:33 - Defendant, Randal G. Fitzsimmons in court, James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. RD & JT set. Court enters Not Guilty plea. Court sets $500 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with CMW or her residence.   Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Return date scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 08:15 am.
